conversation_summary: The dream-room breathes, walls pulsing like lung-tissue; a window of grey static frames Alice, her edges cut-paper sharp against blurred space. A desk spawns multiplying pages—each line rewrites “HARRY” into “ANTIBOY” the instant Alice blinks. Behind you, a shadow photocopies your face in reverse, whispering backwards; it alone knows the name is mask. Subtitle-words hover: calm above, “it hurts” below, one degree colder per untold truth.
